isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: HOLSET SS 296 AND QE 296/338 - CLEAN AND INSPECT - QE COMPRESSOR

step1.para: Inspect the intake and exhaust valves for cracks or damage, especially around the edges ( Figure 56)

figure.caption: Figure 56. Inspect Exhaust and Intake Valves

step1.para: Measure the flatness of the intake and exhaust valves. Both valves must be flat within .001 inch (.03 mm) ( Figure 57).

Replace valves if cracked, damaged, or not flat. New intake and exhaust valves are available in the Valve Maintenance Kit ( Figure 10) or Component Maintenance and Service Kits ( Figure 11and Figure 12).

note.para: International recommends new valves be installed.

figure.caption: Figure 58. Unloader Cap - Check for Scoring

step1.para: Replace unloader cap if scored or damaged. A new unloader valve cap is available in the Unloader Maintenance Kit ( Figure 9) or Component and Unloader Service Kits ( Figure 12 and Figure 14).
Inspect the valve seat surfaces in the valve body ( Figure 59).

note.para: Inspection of the valve seats in the valve body requires specialized equipment and is beyond the scope of field service.

step1.para: If the valve seat is visibly damaged, or cannot be cleaned, the valve body must be replaced. A new valve body is available (pre-assembled) in the Valve Body Service kit ( Figure 13).
Gasket sealing surfaces must be clean and free of all old gasket material, carbon, rust, and other buildup. Surfaces must be free of scratches, gouges, burrs, and other deformities.
Inspect the head for damage and flatness.
Gasket sealing surfaces must be clean and free of all old gasket material, carbon, rust, and other buildup. Surfaces must be free of scratches, gouges, burrs, and other deformities ( Figure 60).
After making sure all gasket surfaces are clean and free of the above, inspect the head for flatness.
Single cylinder heads must be flat within .001 inch (.03 mm) between any two adjacent bolt holes. Use a flat plate and feeler gauge ( Figure 61).

figure.caption: Figure 61. Cylinder Head - Use Flat Plate and Feeler Gauge

step1.para: If the head is visibly damaged, or cannot be cleaned, the head must be replaced. A new head is available in either of the Head Service Kits ( Figure 15and Figure 16). These kits are pre-assembled except for the air intake gasket.
Inspect the cover for damage and flatness.
Gasket sealing surfaces must be clean and free of all old gasket material, carbon, rust, and other buildup. Surfaces must be free of scratches, gouges, burrs, and other deformities.
After making sure all gasket surfaces are clean and free of the above, inspect the head for flatness.
Single cylinder top cover must be flat within .0025 inch (.06 mm) between any two adjacent bolt holes and .004 inch (.10 mm) total. Use a flat plate and feeler gauge ( Figure 62).

figure.caption: Figure 62. Top Cover - Use Flat Plate and Feeler Gauge

step1.para: If the cover is visibly damaged, or cannot be cleaned, the cover must be replaced. A new cover is available in either of the Head Service Kits ( Figure 15and Figure 16). These kits are pre-assembled except for the air intake gasket.

Use a valve spring tester (ZTSE-2241) to check the unloader valve spring ( Figure 63). Replace any spring that does not meet the following force limits when compressed to a length of .98 inch (24.9 mm): minimum of 23 lbs. (10.4 kg) and maximum of 27 lbs. (12.5 kg).

note.para: International recommends that a new spring be installed during any servicing of the unloader assembly.
